meanings.definition: To apply a new layer of gold to something.
meanings.sent1: She regilds the picture frame to make it shiny again.
meanings.sent2: The artist regilds the statue to enhance its beauty.
meanings.sent3: The king regilds his crown for the royal ceremony.
meanings.sent4: The sun regilds the clouds with a golden hue at sunset.
meanings.sent5: The jeweler regilds the necklace, making it sparkle like new.

meanings.definition: To restore or renew the appearance of something by adding gold.
meanings.sent1: He regilds the antique mirror to bring back its elegance.
meanings.sent2: The craftsman regilds the chandelier to give it a luxurious look.
meanings.sent3: The magician regilds his wand for a touch of glamour in his act.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter regilds the room with warmth and joy.
meanings.sent5: The sunset regilds the horizon with a golden glow, painting the sky.

meanings.sent1: The regilds of the frames were done meticulously by the artist.
meanings.sent2: The regilds on the artifacts brought out their true beauty.
meanings.sent3: The regilds at the museum added a touch of opulence to the displays.
meanings.sent4: His smile was like a regilds, brightening up the whole room.
meanings.sent5: The regilds of the sunrise transformed the sky into a masterpiece of colors.
